title: Computer "screen" type face, OCR?
content:
I’m beginning to suspect that this font is “hand drawn” (for what it’s worth, heh), but if anyone can identify it, it would be a great help.

We had a graphic design firm do a logo for us originally, (who have since gone out of business) and they provided practically everything BUT the font to us.

It bears a close resemblance to OCR A and OCR A II, but as you can see it’s not quite right.

Please help!

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [brightfont.png](http://web.archive.org/web/20080406044307/http:/typophile.com/files/brightfont.png) | 13.14 KB |

 [‹ Looks like Kuenstler, but not quite](http://web.archive.org/web/20080406044307/http:/typophile.com/node/43058 "Go to previous forum topic") [Font ID Please... ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080406044307/http:/typophile.com/node/43053 "Go to next forum topic")
author: haibane

comments.content:
Looks custom and shouldn’t be hard to redraw if it’s just about the logo.  
Could have started out as [Russell Square](http://web.archive.org/web/20080406044307/http:/myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/russell-square/).
Something even closer would be [Super Duty Narrow Closed Sharp](http://web.archive.org/web/20080406044307/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/typeco/super-duty/narrow-closed-sharp-light/) from Typeco.
